intro: Melandrium macrocarpum var. trachyodon, commonly known as the rough-seeded catchfly, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds. This species is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions.
